p: In comparison to the daily values ( Food and Drug Administration, 2013), a 100 g of the leaves can provide about 41.2–46.7% of daily value for crude fibre, 19.6–22.2% daily value for crude protein, 16.0–18.1% of daily value for caloric value, 15.7–17.8% of daily value for carbohydrate, 15.7–17.8% of daily value for crude fat ( Table 1). A 100 g of the stems can provide 51.6–56.2% of daily value for crude fibre, 18.4–20.1% of daily value for carbohydrate, 15.0–16.3% of daily value for caloric value, 10.3–11.2% of daily value crude fat and 8.8–9.6% of daily value for crude protein.
